tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE historical_figures (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    birth_date DATE,
    nationality VARCHAR(50),
    occupation VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE historical_figures (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  birth_date DATE,
  death_date DATE,
  occupation VARCHAR(50),
  description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE historical_events (
  event_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  event_date DATE,
  location VARCHAR(50),
  description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE historical_figures_events (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    figure_id INT,
    event_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (figure_id) REFERENCES historical_figures(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES historical_events(id)
);

CREATE TABLE HistoricalFigures (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  birth_date DATE,
  death_date DATE,
  occupation VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE Countries (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  country_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  continent VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE Events (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  date DATE,
  description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE Relationships (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  figure_id INT,
  related_figure_id INT,
  relationship_type VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE historical_figures (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255),
  birth_date DATE,
  occupation VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE historical_events (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name VARCHAR(255),
  event_date DATE,
  description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE countries (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  country_name VARCHAR(255),
  continent VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE achievements (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  achievement_name VARCHAR(255),
  historical_figure_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (historical_figure_id) REFERENCES historical_figures(id)
)

CREATE TABLE relationships (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  historical_figure1_id INT,
  historical_figure2_id INT,
  relationship_type VARCHAR(255)
)
